intro: Tephroseris crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant is distinguished by its thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, aiding in water retention in arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tephroseris crassifolia is often found in rocky soils and dry landscapes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
